StudyInfo.StudyNameEntrez: Center for Common Disease Genomics [CCDG] - Neuropsychiatric: Autism - Simons Simplex Collection (SSC)

Person.Organization: COLUMBIA UNIVERSITY HEALTH SCIENCESHARVARD UNIVERSITYNEW YORK GENOME CENTER

Policy.acknowledgement_statement:
All Studies: Research reported in this publication was supported by the National Human Genome Research Institute of the National Institutes of Health under Award Number UM1HG008901. The content is solely the responsibility of the authors and does not necessarily represent the official views of the National Institutes of Health.
Simons Simplex Cohort: We are grateful to all of the families at the participating Simons Simplex Collection (SSC) sites, as well as the principal investigators (A. Beaudet, R. Bernier, J. Constantino, E. Cook, E. Fombonne, D. Geschwind, R. Goin-Kochel, E. Hanson, D. Grice, A. Klin, D. Ledbetter, C. Lord, C. Martin, D. Martin, R. Maxim, J. Miles, O. Ousley, K. Pelphrey, B. Peterson, J. Piggot, C. Saulnier, M. State, W. Stone, J. Sutcliffe, C. Walsh, Z. Warren, E. Wijsman).

GSR_Access.gsr_mode_label: Unrestricted access (institution did not respond within six months)

ConsentGroup.title: Disease-Specific (Autism or other Neurodevelopmental Disease, IRB)
ConsentGroup.name: DS-AONDD-IRB
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction:
Use of the data must be related to Autism or other Neurodevelopmental Disease. Requestor must provide documentation of local IRB approval.
A letter of approval from the Simons Foundation must accompany all data access requests submitted to dbGaP. This letter should be appended to the IRB approval document.
